enWisdom: Nobleness is control over one’s tongue and doing good to others

Wisdom: اخْزُنْ لِسَانَكَ كَمَا تَخْزُنُ ذَهَبَكَ وَوَرِقَكَ
enWisdom: Safeguard your tongue just as you treasure your gold and your money

Wisdom: احْفَظْ رَأْسَكَ مِنْ [عَنْ‏] عَثْرَةِ لِسَانِكَ وَازْمُمْهُ بِالنَّهْيِ وَالْحَزْمِ وَالتُّقَى وَالْعَقْلِ
enWisdom: Protect your head from the slips of your tongue, and constrain it with reason, judiciousness, God-wariness and intellect

Wisdom: احْبِسْ لِسَانَكَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُطِيلَ حَبْسَكَ وَيُرْدِي نَفْسَكَ فَلَا شَيْ‏ءَ أَوْلَى بِطُولِ سِجْنٍ مِنْ لِسَانٍ يَعْدِلُ عَنِ الصَّوَابِ وَيَتَسَرَّعُ إِلَى الْجَوَابِ
enWisdom: Restrain your tongue before it prolongs your incarceration and destroys your soul, for there is nothing more worthy of long imprisonment than a tongue that has strayed from the right and is hasty in responding

Wisdom: حِفْظُ اللِّسَانِ وَبَذْلُ الْإِحْسَانِ مِنْ أَفْضَلِ فَضَائِلِ الْإِنْسَانِ
enWisdom: Safeguarding the tongue and doing good to others are from the best merits of a human being

Wisdom: حَدُّ السِّنَانِ يَقْطَعُ الْأَوْصَالَ وَحَدُّ اللِّسَانِ يَقْطَعُ الْآجَالَ
enWisdom: The edge of a spearhead severs the appendages [of the body] whereas the edge of the tongue cuts short lifetimes
Restraining the tongue is [a means of attaining] fortune and authority while setting it free is [a cause of] destruction

Wisdom: لِسَانُكَ إِنْ أَمْسَكْتَهُ [إِنْ أَسْكَتَّهُ‏] أَنْجَاكَ وَإِنْ أَطْلَقْتَهُ أَرْدَاكَ
enWisdom: If you restrain your tongue, it will save you and if you set it free, it will ruin you
One who does not control his tongue regrets

Wisdom: مَنْ سَجَنَ لِسَانَهُ أَمِنَ مِنْ نَدَمِهِ
enWisdom: One who imprisons his tongue remains safe from regret

Wisdom: مَنْ أَمَّرَ عَلَيْهِ لِسَانَهُ قَضَى بِحَتْفِهِ
enWisdom: One who makes his tongue his master has decreed his own death
One who restrains his tongue is safe from regret
One who protects his tongue honours himself

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطْلَقَ لِسَانَهُ أَبَانَ عَنْ سُخْفِهِ
enWisdom: One who sets his tongue free demonstrates his own foolishness
Guarding the tongue is part of faith

Wisdom: مَا عَقَدَ إِيمَانَهُ مَنْ لَمْ يَحْفَظْ لِسَانَهُ
enWisdom: One who does not guard his tongue has not completed his faith

Wisdom: لَا تُكْثِرْ فَتُضْجِرَ وَلَا تُفَرِّطْ فَتَسْقُطَ
enWisdom: Do not talk so much that you annoy others and do not speak so less that you fall [in the eyes of others]

Wisdom: لَا يَتَّقِي الشَّرَّ فِي فِعْلِهِ إِلَّا مَنْ يَتَّقِيهِ فِي قَوْلِهِ
enWisdom: None is careful of evil in his actions but he who is careful of evil in his speech

Wisdom: لَا شَيْ‏ءَ أَعْوَدُ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ مِنْ حِفْظِ اللِّسَانِ وَبَذْلِ الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: Nothing is more beneficial for a human being than guarding the tongue and doing good to others
